page.title: 06Nercwys and Eryrys - Trees
page.content: The eastern and lower part of the area is made up of fields through which are several tracks and narrow lanes which are bordered by old hedges of mixed shrubs and mature trees. Varieties include ash, hazel, holly, wild cherry, hawthorn, willow, oak, sloe, beech and more recently sycamore. There are three main areas of mixed woodland - Tir-y-coed near Woodlands Cottage, woods near Glyn Terrig in the south east of the region and Coed Gwern Rhiw. There are fir plantations, privately owned to the north of Tir-y-coed, and Forestry Commission on a large area of Nercwys Mountain. The forest, of mainly spruce and larch, is in great need of thinning. On higher ground there are few trees, mainly mountain ash and silver birch.
